body.p: A Kentucky merchant. Raised in Indiana and returned to Hawesville, Kentucky in 1831. Engaged as a tobacco merchant. Lived in Hancock County, Kentucky in 1860. Married to Sarah Ann Wroe McAdams. Father of Eliza J. McAdams Sterrett, Ann McAdams Hawes, William Lindsay McAdams, Mary Catherine McAdams Gregory, Forrest Calvert McAdams, Frank B. McAdams, and Charles McAdams. Owned five and hired one enslaved persons in 1860. A commissioner of the Hancock Manufacturing Companyâ€“engaged in the the manufacturing of glass, wool, cotton, and hemp--and the Hancock Mining Company in 1851.
